title: Only use ByVal values in the proc-macro bridge call ABI

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-macros
labels.description: Area: All kinds of macros (custom derive, macro_rules!, proc macros, ..)

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
The current bridge call ABI uses structs that are too big to be passed in registers. This means that they have to be passed at a fixed stack offset according to the SystemV abi for x86_64. This is harder to implement in a codegen backend that normal values passed either in a register, or passing a pointer to the value in a register. While I have a [WIP PR](https://github.com/bytecodealliance/wasmtime/pull/1559) to implement the correct behavior for passing structs on the stack for Cranelift, it will likely take a while before it is merged given the amount of changes.

For example

https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/25f070d1edf3d54d8933e00eeac95ce55ca8eabb/src/libproc_macro/bridge/client.rs#L390-L393

could become:

```rust
extern "C" fn run( 
     bridge: *mut Bridge<'_>, 
     f: fn(crate::TokenStream) -> crate::TokenStream, 
 ) -> *mut Buffer<u8> { 
```

`*mut Bridge<'_>` and `*mut Buffer<u8>` could be wrapped in a `#[repr(transparent)]` struct.

cc @eddyb (author of the proc-macro bridge)

@rustbot modify labels: +A-cranelift
